body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky,

Your petitioner respectfully represents that he was indicted at the last February Term of the Fayette Circuit Court for assault and battery that he has been tried and found guilty and a fine of $100; and three months imprisonment assessed against him. While he admits the simple fact of having committed the offense charged he consider, the puneshment very severe. He says he is without money or friends and unless the fine and imprisonment is remitted he will have to stay in jail for about 140 days. In order to avoid this disagreeable necessity, he proposes and promises that if he is released that he will join the U S Army for three years or during the war. That he as always been a Union man, loyal to his government.

He prays that your excellency will remit his imprisonment and that part of the fine in your power and that you will respite the ^residue^ case for, say three months
by which time he will be able pay the ^Commonwealths^ Attorney and other officers their fees, Which is respectfully submitted
Sworn to before me this 24 June 1864

Provided George Payne will join the army for three years or during the war the undersigned would respectfully recommend a remission of the fine and imprisonment against him.
